text:
Apologies if I missed this somewhere, but will `Yggdrasil` use `1.6.0` when it is released or will it continue to use a certain commit?
I'm a step behind the CI env on my local right now and just trying to figure out if I should re-compile again or be lazy and just wait until the official binaries come out.

elements.text: Apologies if I missed this somewhere, but will

when it is released or will it continue to use a certain commit?
I'm a step behind the CI env on my local right now and just trying to figure out if I should re-compile again or be lazy and just wait until the official binaries come out.

text: at the moment we're using julia 1.6.0-rc1

elements.text: at the moment we're using julia 1.6.0-rc1

text: you can see it in any log on azure pipelines: <https://dev.azure.com/JuliaPackaging/Yggdrasil/_build/results?buildId=9568&view=logs&j=96c13d9d-dfd2-51e5-2f76-4a0b3ce09abc&t=09532434-8b0a-5f0e-118d-a3181cde5ec8&l=12>

elements.text: you can see it in any log on azure pipelines:

text: Yeah, I saw that, but I was asking if it will stay on the 1.6.0 release when that is out or will continue to update to catch certain features between point releases.

elements.text: Yeah, I saw that, but I was asking if it will stay on the 1.6.0 release when that is out or will continue to update to catch certain features between point releases.

text: _hopefully_, we can stay on v1.6 for a while.  it's better not to have to walk through the bugs of an unstable version :sweat_smile:

elements.text: , we can stay on v1.6 for a while.  it's better not to have to walk through the bugs of an unstable version
